update.description:
This PR depends on [this ign-physics PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/52/). This allows the physics system to respect the `<mesh><scale>` SDF element that can be set by users.

However, we should wait to merge this, because I’ve noticed that rendering engine does not seem to account for the SDF mesh scale currently. I’m honestly not sure how to adjust a mesh’s scale for the renderer. If anyone knows how to make that happen, please feel free to make the change in this PR, and then we can consider merging it.

The related `ign-physics` PR can be merged at any time without any negative side effects.

content.html: Ok, that homebrew failure is expected, I think we don't have an issue tracking it yet, but it's due to different hash_codes for components across shared libs

content.raw:
I made a new release, but the debbuild job doesn't use the dart PPA, so it can't find dart 6.7.2 and didn't build the dartsim plugin:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ign-physics-debbuilder/8/consoleFull
content.html:
I made a new release, but the debbuild job doesn't use the dart PPA, so it can't find dart 6.7.2 and didn't build the dartsim plugin:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/debbuild/job/ign-physics-debbuilder/8/consoleFull

content.raw: I can confirm upgrading to 6.7.2 fixes this. Note [this ign-cmake PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/130) is required to build with dart 6.7.2.
content.html: I can confirm upgrading to 6.7.2 fixes this. Note this ign-cmake PR is required to build with dart 6.7.2.

pull_request.title: [Do not merge] Pass the <scale> information from sdf to the physics engine

pullrequest.title: [Do not merge] Pass the <scale> information from sdf to the physics engine

content.raw: In that case, it may be caused by the [phantom contacts](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1185) from the Bullet collision detector which have been removed as of dartsim 6.7.0, which was released relatively recently. The version of `libdart6-dev` that's currently available on the dartsim apt repo is 6.7.2, so upgrading `libdart6-dev` to the latest version might also fix this instead of switching from Bullet to FCL.
content.html: In that case, it may be caused by the phantom contacts from the Bullet collision detector which have been removed as of dartsim 6.7.0, which was released relatively recently. The version of libdart6-dev that's currently available on the dartsim apt repo is 6.7.2, so upgrading libdart6-dev to the latest version might also fix this instead of switching from Bullet to FCL.

pullrequest.title: [Do not merge] Pass the <scale> information from sdf to the physics engine

content.raw:
It seems like the offset is coming from ign-physics. Using the default collision detector by commenting out [lines 298-299](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/src/79bf3aa1b63bf11506de9c9b2b2a4a0ed6850faa/dartsim/src/EntityManagementFeatures.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#EntityManagementFeatures.cc-298) gets rid of the offset.

![Screenshot from 2019-01-18 11-28-19.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/2110295312-Screenshot_from_2019-01-18_11-28-19.png)
content.html: It seems like the offset is coming from ign-physics. Using the default collision detector by commenting out lines 298-299 gets rid of the offset.

pullrequest.title: [Do not merge] Pass the <scale> information from sdf to the physics engine

content.raw:
Adding camera sensors to the mix exposes even more problems, see how the duck size is different on the 3D view and the camera view:

![meshscale.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/4210729206-meshscale.png)

The camera sensor's mesh scale is set [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/6264cbd5eccc6376dae4a40107299f91b6039c16/src/systems/sensors/SceneManager.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#SceneManager.cc-293).
content.html:
Adding camera sensors to the mix exposes even more problems, see how the duck size is different on the 3D view and the camera view:

The camera sensor's mesh scale is set here.
